titleStmt.title:
A Character Satyr & Panygerick on the
Legion Club

publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: As I strol'd the City oft I
Spy'd a building large & lofty:
Not a bow shot from the Colledge,
Half the Globe from sen\c·over·s\e & knowledge
By the prudent Architect
Placed against the Church direct
Making good my Grandames jest
Near the Church── you know the rest
Tell us what the Pile Contains
Many a head that has no brains
These Demoniacks let me dub
With the name of Legion Club
Such assemblies you might swear
Meet when Butchers b\ai·over·ea\t a Bear
Such a noi\s·over·c\e & such haranguing
When a brother Thief is hanging
Such a rout & such a Rabble
Run to hear Iack-pudding gabble
Such a croud their ordure throws
On a fearless Villains nose
Cou'd I from the building top
Hear the ratling thunder drop
While the Devil upon the Roof
(If the Devil be thunder proof)
Should with Poker fiery red
Crack the stones & melt the lead
Drive them down on every Scull
While the Den of Thieves is full
Quite destroy the Harpies Nest
How might then our Isle be blest
For divines allow that God
Sometimes makes the Devil his Rod
And the Gospel will inform us
He can punish sins enormous.
Yet should Swift endow his Schools
For the Lunaticks and fools
With a rood or two of Land
J allow the Pile may stand:
you perhaps will ask me why so
But it is with this Proviso
Since the House is like to last
Let a royal grant be past
That the Club have right to dwell
Each within his proper Cell
With a passage left to creep in
And a hole above to peep in
Let them when they once get in
Sell the nation for a pin
While they sit a picking Straws,
Let them rave of making laws;
While they never hold their tongue
Let them dabble in their dung;
Let them form a grand Committee,
How to plague & starve the City;
Let them stare & storm & frown,
When they see a Clergy-Gown;
Let them, e'er they crack a louse,
Call for the orders of the House;
Let them with their Goslin quills,
Scribble senseless heads of Bills
We may while they strain their throats
Wipe our A────s with their Votes;
Let Sir Thom: that rampant Ass,
Stuff his guts with flax and grass;
But before the Priest he fleeces,
Tear the bible all to pieces;
At the Parsons, Tom holloo boy
Worthy offspring of a shoe boy
Footman; traytor, vile seducer
Perjur'd rebel, brib'd accuser
Lay thy paultry priveledge aside
Vile decendant of a Regicide
Fall a working like a Mole,
Raise a dirt about your hole;
Come assist me Muse obedient,
Let us try some new expedient;
Shift the Scene for half an hour,
Time and place are in thy power,
Thither gentle muse conduct me,
I shall ask, and you instruct me;
See the Muse unbars the Gate,
Hark, the Monkeys how they prate
All ye Gods who rule the soul
Styx thro' Hell whose waters roll;
let me be allowd to tell,
what I heard in yonder Cell.
near the door an entrance gapes,
Crouded round with antick Shapes
poverty, & grief, & care,
causless Joy, & foul despair,
discord perriwig'd with Snakes,
Mark! the dreadfull strides she takes
By this odious crew beset,
I began to rage and fret,
and resolved to break their pates
e'er we enter'd in the Gates
had not Clio, in the Nick
Whisper'd me, lay down yr stick:
what said I is this the Mad House?
No (say's she), these are but shadows,
Phantoms bodyless and vain,
Empty visions of the brain;
in the Port Briareus Stands,
with a bribe in all his hands,
Briareus the Secretary
but we mortals call him C\are·over·???\y,·Secretary to the Duke of Dorset Lord Lieut. of Jreland \note added in the correcting hand\.
when the rogues their country fleece
they may hope for pence apiece.
Clio who had been so wise,
to put on a fools disguise
to bespeak some approbation,
and be thought a near relation,
when she saw 200 brutes
all involv'd in wild disputes
roaring till their lungs were spent,
Priviledge of Parliament.
Now a new misfortune feels,
dreading to be laid by the Heels;
never durst a muse before,
enter that infernal door;
Clio Stifled with the Smell,
into Spleen and vapours fell;
by the Stygian Steams that flew
from this dire infernal crew.
not the Stench of Lake Avernus,
could have more offended her Nose
had she flown but on the top
she must feel her pinions drop
And by exhalation dire,
tho' a Goddess, must expire;
in a fright she crept away,
bravely I resolved to stay,
when I saw the Keeper frown
tipping him with half a crown
now said I; we are alone
name your Heroes one by one
who is that Hell featur'd brawler,
is it Satan; no, tis Waller,
honest Keeper drive him further
in his looks are Hell and Murder;
in what figure can a Bard dress,
Jack the grandson of Sir Hardress,
See his groveling visage drop
Just as when he murder'd Throp.
Keeper shew me where to fix
on the puppy pair of Dicks
By their lanthorn Iaws, & leathern,
you may swear they both are brethren
Dick ·Tighe. Fits-baker ·Bettesw\hole\. Dick the player,
old acquaintance are you there,
dear companions hug and kiss
toast old glorious in your Piss
tye them Keeper in a tether,
let them Stare & Stink together,
both are apt to be unruly,
lash them daily, lash them duly;
tho' tis hopeless to reclaim them,
Scorpion rods perhaps may tame them.
Keeper yon old dotard smoak,
sweetly Snoring in his Cloak,
who is he; tis Hum drum ·\del·Colonel·add·General·underscored\. Wynne
half encompassd with his kin
there observe the tribe of Bingham
for he never fails to bring them.
\add·in·pencil·(\And the base apostate Vesey
with Bishops scraps grown fat & greasy\add·in·pencil·)\
\hole\hile he sleeps the whole debate
\hole\y submissive round him wait
\hole\ would gladly see the Hunks
\hole\ · grave to search his trunks,
\hole\ ey gently twitch his Coat
\hole\ · yawn, & give his Vote;
\hole\ays true to his vocation,
for the court, against the Nation.
those are Allens, Iack & Bob
first in every wicked Iob
son & Brother to a queer
brain·sick brute, they call a Peer
we must give them better quarter,
for their ancestor trod mortar,
and at Howth to boast his fame
on a chimney carv'd his Name
There sits ·Colonel. Clements ·General half Brother to Mṛ Boyle speaker to the House of Commons. Dilks ·Master of the Rolls. Carter
who for Hell would die a Martyr,
Such a triplet could you tell
where to find on this Side Hell
Gallows Carter Dilks & Clements
Souse them in their own excrements,
om.
om.
ev'ry mischief in their hearts
if they fail 'tis want of parts
bless us ·Marcus Anthony. Morgan! art thou there Man
bless my eyes, art thou the Chair·Man
Chair·man to yon damn'd Committee
yet I look on thee with pity,
dreadfull sight, what learned Morgan\add·in·pencil·!\
Metamorphos'd to a Gorgon!
for thy horrid looks I own
half convert me into Stone
hast thou been so long at School,
now to turn a factious fool!
Alma Mater was thy mother,
ev'ry young divine thy brother
thou a disobedient Varlet\pencil·!·over·,\
treat thy mother like an Harlot\pencil·!·over·,\
thou ungratefull to thy teachers\pencil·!·over·,\
who are all grown revd preachers,
Morgan would it not Surprise one
turns his nourishment to poyson;
when you walk among your Books
they'll reproach you with their looks
bind them fast or from their shelves
they'll come down and \pencil·right·over·write\ themselves
Homer, Virgil, Plutarch, Flaccus,
all in arms prepare to back us,
soon repent or put to Slaughter
ev'ry Greek & Roman author;
will you in your factious phrase
send the Clergy all to graze;
And to make your project pass
leave them not a blade of Grass\pencil·.\
how I want thee humourous Hogarth\pencil·!\
thou I hear a pleasant rogue art,
were but you & I acquainted
every Monster should be painted
you should try the graving tools
on this odious group of fools
draw them as I now describe them
form their features while I gibe them
draw them like, for I assure you,
you will want no Caracatura,
draw them so, that we may trace
all the Soul in every face
Keeper I must now retire
you have done what I desire,
for I feel my spirits spent
with the noise, the sight, & scent
Pray be patient, you shall find
half the best are still behind
you have hardly seen a score
I can shew two hundred more
Keeper I have seen enough;
taking then a pinch of Snuff,
I concluded, looking round them
May their God the Devil Confound them
om.
om.
take them Satan as your due
all except the fifty two
